comment: you don't learn a lot but it is easy to pass. The exams follows the study guide exactly and the group project is not that hard, it just takes time. Don't expect a lot but you can take the class she's fine.

She is a great teacher and makes the class very interesting. If you hate group project this is not the teacher for you since 25% of the overall grade is a group project (paper & oral presentation that is all due at the end of the semester.) is an easy and very interesting class. I highly recommend it.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great professor! I took this class as a hybrid and all quizzes were online and answers were straight from the book. No final, which is great! Tests were in class though, but I didn't think they were too hard. This was my easy class. I would definitely recommend this professor!!!! If you show up to class, I think anyone could make at least a B.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I love the textbook she uses, it has a ton of great info. this was my easy class for the semester so I did not read as in-depth as I wanted. Everything is on the internet, I suggest the e-book for tests tho. I did everything last minute and got a 96. Take her online instead of face to face especially if your an 18 credit hour semester student.

I hate how few grades you get in this class. If you miss a couple of the weekly quizzes, you're screwed. I also hate how tests are in class despite being a hybrid. Dr. G is a cool lady but not a good teacher. She rarely ever lectured and like others have said, we watched a ton of documentaries that were pretty dry overall. I'd take someone else.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I've never had a hybrid where so much in-class time is wasted. All the tests are inclass; a weekly assignment & quiz are the only things you do online. The answers are all on Quizlet - don't bother getting the text. There's a huge group project with a lot of members. she gives you no class time to meet. We watched documentaries, she barely lectures
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She made this class a lot harder than it should've been. Most assignments are easy but you have to go to class to get credit. Her lectures aren't really lectures because most of the time they're boring documentaries about topics that are hard to understand. I took the hybrid so we didn't really cover a lot of topics in class.

I dont understand the comments & review because I had a newborn, full time job and full time student and manage to pass this class with a B, if I would to actually study could've made an A. I don't like the group project that we did and she only read the 1st email, so dont make a mistake. Final Group project, last essayeasy grader. Got an A on it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Forces you to watch online lectures and do participation quizzes, which were harder than they needed to be.  Tests are easy, but most of the points of the class come from the participations and group work. lectures are not very engaging.  Completely, unsympathetic to students issues outside of class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took the hybrid and a lot of Homework due every saturday night. Makes sure that if you don't come to class, you don't get credit for homework EVEN IF YOU DID IT CORRECTLY. Group project and ridiculously long paper. 3/10 would not recommend. I missed a day during presentations and she brought my grade down. Thumbs down.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Garefino has a lot of applicable knowledge, but she's just not a great teacher. She's pretty monotone and I found her lectures fairly boring. The hybrid course required you to listen to an online lecture and email her some participation. The tests are fairly easy (all multiple choice), but there is a group project that involves a paper.

I took her hybrid course as long as you go to class and follow her syllabus you'll get an easy A. The class itself is dry,  I expected more from it. I didn't feel like I retained anything. There is a semester group project that's 25% of your grade and you're randomly assigned the groups. 3 exams and you have to take those in person.

Dr. Garefino is a very respected professor. Her class has clear guidelines to what is expected, which makes succeeding in her class easy. Lectures were  little dry for me at first, but I grew to love her class. Semester long group project was the only negative to this course- but I can't really blame Dr. Garefino. I would definitely recommend her.

One of the easiest online classes I've taken (and I've taken a lot at KSU). You have 5 modules and 3-ish weeks for most of them. SO much time to get things done. 2 tests, 5 module assignments, 4 discussions, multiple quizzes each module, and a research paper (which is the hardest thing assignment wise). You'll be reading A LOT.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I just dont know what to say about her. I did not like lectures online and in class. I thought the hybrid was stupid. I honestly did not learn anything from her class. Her TA is the worst. The Ta didnot do study sessions or offer any help. If messaged she didnt know anything either. I dont even know why she has a TA as all she did was pass out test

Garefino was a nice lady, she was very helpful when needed. Weekly easy homework assignments that add up to a big part of your grade. Test were okay. Just make sure to read the chapters and do not skip. Attendance matters. The paper at the end I think she grades too hard. My group was unorganized

Took this class online.  Chapter quizzes and module-end exams are online, multiple choice, and straight from the book. Discussion questions and  some really interesting  small assignments in between. One research paper/proposal at the end of the semester. Safe to take if you also have other classes.  There was no group assignment.

I took the Hybrid class. There is a lot of busy work for this class. An online program to raise a virtual baby, and an adult, and online homework each week. There are only 4 tests, no final! She gives out study guides, which you complete, and her test is totally based from the study guide!

(Hybrid) She lectures and gives online lectures with assignment too! Her test are easy with study guides (& not a big percentage). But be ready for a group project worth a large percent of your grade (paper and presentation), not hard but time consuming! I would recommend her, she's nice!

Took this as a hybrid. One group project + individual paper (easy, especially if you get a good group), easy weekly assignments (around 20 min long lectures online. MUST listen to these to do the W.A., and tests. No quizzes. You can tell she loves what she teaches, the subject just didn't interest me. Do the work & you'll get an A.

Just not a very good teacher. You will hear about in the class are about  the Peace Corps, repetitively. Had a problem with the sound one week, and hence could not hear the question, since it was the first week, I didn't know she narrated the slides.  I got a zero for that, and an A in everything else, and somehow got a 89 in the course.

Dr. Garefino is a really nice professor but I hated this class. It's pretty easy all things considered (3 tests, weekly assignments, weekly online participation, 1 paper, 1 group project) but the group project SUCKS. I hate any group stuff and this one was horrible. I would take her again but for a different class. Make sure to do all the work!
she is a great professor.  Take her.

She is a very nice person! The class can be very interesting! My only issue was that she was difficult to comprehend, and was not very clear. I always thought I did better on her test then I actually did and that through me off.

Hybrid class, and missed class twice. Definitely essential to attend class, she often assigns very specific assignments based on in-class material. Online assignments are constant, so you better be prepared to check online often. Easy tests, though, study a bit and you'll do fine. I averaged a high A whilst studying approx 1-2 hours for each test.
BEST PROFESSOR I'VE TAKEN SO FAR AT KSU.great class! easy A

I took this as a hybrid. This class is extremely easy. It's basically like a high school class. She gives you a study guide before the tests and the same questions are asked on the tests. Tests are only worth ten points, so it won't affect your grade too much. She's so nice too. TAKE HER!! :)

I took this as a hybrid class on Wed. at 8 am! Such an interesting and fun class! You basically have complete control of your grade, if you don't do the online assignments (which you should bc she gives you plenty of time to do them) and you review from the study guide you should make an easy A! She's awesome and really nice, take her!!!!

Take her!! SO easy!! You'll have online lectures that you will have to watch and do online assignments but they are SO easy! There's a group project but it's an easy A! She's super sweet, too! Take her :)

she is such a great prof i had her for this course cross cultural psych and lifespan development. assignments/quizzes/reading all counts for homework/quiz grades but all the work gets you ready for the tests and you actually know the material!
Easy A! Tests were super easy and came straight from study guides. Group project can be fun if you have a good group, but still easy! Listening to powerpoints online were annoying though.

Took this class as a hybrid. Most boring class ever, but it can be fun. Weekly assignments and discussion posts. Make sure you stay on top of those assignments because her points add up fast and can mean a huge difference in grade. Definitely an easy A class. 3 exams. No final. Lots of busy work and videos to watch during class.

Her online lectures are boring and don't add much to the class. Make sure you remember to do your weekly assignments and online lectures or it will ruin your grade. Her in class lectures are interesting and she shows a lot of interesting videos. The group project is great if you have a good group. Overall I'd take her again.

Hybrid class-online lectures right from the book, so they did not add any value to the class. Tests were easy! Not a challenging class - easy A if you need an elective. Group project can be fun if you get a motivated group of students.

I took this class as a hybrid course. If you attend the lectures, complete the homework, and review the short, concise study guide she provides for you before the exam then w=you will have no problems succeeding in this course. The only reason someone would give this teacher a bad rating is because the never attended or put forth any effort.

This teacher does not teach one single class. If you ask questions about the information, she does not know the answer. There are two tests, weekly online questions, and a presentation. The class is taught by the students through their presentations. I would not recommend this teacher at all.
Great professor! Challenging to make an A but very easy to make a B. One research paper and presentation. Midterm and Final are hard but she gives a good study guide. Id take her again.
Very good Professor.  Has a lot of good information that really keeps the class fun and interesting.Uses the book a lot for reading material and tests.
Great professor!! Had her last semester.. Read and show up and you will do fine
Best Professer I have ever had. Very fair... I would recommend her.

Pretty boring but not too hard. Definitely need to study for the tests.. they aren't easy. But if you do all the work then you can definitely make a good grade. 1 paper and 1 group presentation, and takes attendance.
She was a very good prof. Take her. Take her. Take her. Easy A If you read and show up!
Dr. Garefino is fantastic!  She's fair, easy, interesting, and knowledgeable.  I really enjoyed her teaching.
Great teacher. Very Fair. Class was interesting and challenging.Would reccomend her.
Good teacher, she's pretty outgoing but loves to talk and goes on forever. Class is easy with only one paper and some questions each week.
